title: McKesson Patient Relationship Solutions Presents New Approaches to Medication Adherence at CBI Conference
text:
McKesson Patient Relationship Solutions Presents New Approaches to Medication Adherence at CBI Conference [October 06, 2015] Tweet 
Serving as a sponsor for CBI's 3 rd Annual Coupon & Co-Pay Off-Set Strategies Conference, McKesson Patient Relationship Solutions (MPRS) presents new approaches to improving patient adherence, leveraging technology and emerging channels to stay ahead of the challenges in an ever-evolving healthcare landscape. 
The Conference, taking place this week, features dozens of educational sessions and roundtables focused on maximizing patient engagement, refining adherence and compliance, and optimizing manufacturer marketing and distribution strategies. MPRS, a leading provider of end-to-end acquisition and adherence solutions for pharmaceutical brands, is an exhibitor and leads several key sessions during this year's event: Reagan Tully, MPRS' Vice President, Strategy and Marketing, moderates " Elevating Your Co-Pay Program to Enable First Fill Compliance. " The panel addresses the barriers to primary medication non-adherence-one of the most significant obstacles for brands-as 33% of patients fail to fill first-time prescriptions. The discussion focuses on overcoming patient financial barriers, maximizing programs through effective execution, and avoiding common mistakes that compromise successful outcomes. Panelists include Robert Polans, Vice President, MCO and Trade, Cempra Inc. and Rich Wartel, President, Two Labs Marketing, LLC. In one of the meeting's keynote presentations, " Transformation of Healthcare-The Power of Pharmacy and Mobile " Stacey Irving, Vice President, Strategic Channel Solution, MPRS, and Lara Loveman, Director of Business Strategy, Mscripts, will offer their perspective on the changing landscape of pharmacy and how mobile solutions in this channel help brands engage patients to better manage their health. This highly anticipated session will give attendees the knowledge they need to leverage HCPs to delivr patient education, adherence support and financial assistance; utilize mHealth in the pharmacy channel to improve patient outcomes while reducing abandonment; empower their brands with collaboration and personalization and evaluate the current capabilities of e-prescribing. MPRS closes the Conference with the Stakeholder Panel, " Improve Patient Adherence Through Enhanced Patient Outcomes and Reduction in Behavioral Barriers ." Amanda Rhodes, M.P.H.,Director, Client Strategy & Solutions for MPRS, will lead a panel of stakeholders including pharmacists, HCPs and manufacturers focused on the importance of providing patients holistic support through coaching and innovation. Attendees will learn what "improved adherence" requires, how to drive smarter, more informed outreach and achieve healthier outcomes and the best way to support patients while positively impacting adherence. "There is no question that acquisition and adherence programs play a significant role in advancing patient compliance to prescribed therapies. McKesson research continues to reinforce the importance of engaging patients in even more meaningful ways-through every step of their journey," said Derek Rago, MPRS Vice President/General Manager. "McKesson is pleased to once again sponsor CBI's Coupon & Co-Pay Conference. We value the opportunity to share our experiences with brands committed to simplifying the patient experience, transforming lives and advancing healthier outcomes." 
About McKesson Patient Relationship Solutions 
McKesson Patient Relationship Solutions (MPRS) is a business unit of McKesson Corporation. MPRS was created to deliver comprehensive, industry-leading acquisition and adherence solutions for pharmaceutical and device manufacturers. MPRS' U.S.-based, healthcare Contact Centers support patients, pharmacists and physicians to advance outcomes throughout every step of the healthcare experience. MPRS helps brands connect with patients to drive brand performance- for better health . To learn more, visit www.mckesson.com/mprs . 
About McKesson 
McKesson Corporation, currently ranked 11th on the FORTUNE 500, is a healthcare services and information technology company dedicated to making the business of healthcare run better. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. McKesson helps its customers improve their financial, operational and clinical performance with solutions that include pharmaceutical and medical-surgical supply management, healthcare information technology, and business and clinical services.
